title: Rugby World Cup quarter-final referee Jaco Peyper appears to mock Sebastien Vahaamahina
text:
Jaco Peyper has rubbed salt into France's wounds after posing for a controversial picture with Wales fans after officiating Sunday's dramatic World Cup quarter-final.

France had been leading the quarter-final contest 19-10 in Oita before Peyper showed a red card to Sebastien Vahaamahina for an elbow on Wales' Aaron Wainwright.

The elbow ended up costing France as Wales went on to clinch their semi-final spot with a tense 20-19 victory and just hours after the game, Peyper appeared to mock Vahaamahina.

Jaco Peyper dans un bel hommage à Vahaamahina. Photo de Fabien Heuzé pic.twitter.com/g5vo93413s — Arnaud Coudry (@ArnaudCoudry) October 20, 2019

Sebastien Vahaamahina was shown a red by Jaco Peyper for an elbow on Aaron Wainwright

In a picture circulating on social media, the referee can be seen posing alongside some jubilant Welsh fans while seemingly mimicking the game-changing red card on Sunday.

The 39-year-old South African can be seen raising his elbow out in the picture while smiling for the camera.

Vahaamahina's costly elbow was the biggest talking point on Sunday after he was given his marching orders in the 48th minute.

Vahaamahina smashes his elbow into the face of Wainwright during the quarter-final

During a maul, the France lock grappled his right arm around Wainwright's neck before pulling it away and launching his elbow back into his face.

The Wales flanker winced in pain as the maul continued, with the incident being looked at in a TMO review by the referee soon after.

After a short deliberation, Vahaamahina was dismissed, leaving his side to play the rest of the game with 14 men.
description: Jaco Peyper has rubbed salt into France's wounds after posing for a picture with Wales fans after officiating Sunday's dramatic World Cup quarter-final.
